description:
Newton Openstack:
-------------------
On launching an instance using an image, once the image is created, no image name is populated against it the instance list or instance details. 


Mitaka Openstack:
-------------------
On the Mitaka dashboard, Source panel on Launch instance window gives the option to create and attach a new volume of desired size along with the image used to create an instance. However, when I try to create an instance with an image and along with a new volume attached, the instance gets created successfully but does not show the image details.
title: Image name not populated against an Instance

comments.content:
Newton Openstack:
-------------------
On launching an instance using an image, once the image is created, no image name is populated against it the instance list or instance details. 


Mitaka Openstack:
-------------------
On the Mitaka dashboard, Source panel on Launch instance window gives the option to create and attach a new volume of desired size along with the image used to create an instance. However, when I try to create an instance with an image and along with a new volume attached, the instance gets created successfully but does not show the image details.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~divyamv

comments.content: This sounds like a Horizon issue to triage. The server response should have an image id in it, and some tools, like nova CLI, will show the image name along with the image id, but I don't know about Horizon.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
In my understanding, image ID is not populated when a server is launched from a volume created from a image.

In case of Nova CLI, --block-device option is used to do this.
--block-device bootindex=0,id=2356567d-4e91-45ac-b1c5-b93289f47a2f,source=image,dest=volume,size=1
In Horizon, this happens when 'Boot Source' is 'Image' and 'Create New Volume' is 'Yes'.

In  the recent Launch instance panel in Horizon, "Create New Volume" defaults to Yes when 'Image' is selected as 'Boot Source'. The default behavior has been changed in recent release (mitaka?). Could you check what options are chosen.
